alert.note: Alert for St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued October 25 at 5:36AM CDT until October 25 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central St. Landry Parish in central Louisiana... * Until 600 AM CDT. * At 535 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Lawtell, or near Church Point, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Opelousas around 545 AM CDT. Leonville around 550 AM CDT. Washington around 555 AM CDT. Port Barre around 600 AM CDT. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 14 and 27. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
